summary.text_en: Watson and Crick discovered DNA double helix structure! He pieced together life's code book with molecular models. A pairs with T, G pairs with C, revealing how genetic information replicates and transmits.

story.text_en: In 1953, 25-year-old American Watson collaborated with Crick at Cambridge. They built DNA models with wire and cardboard, trying combinations like a puzzle. When discovering A-T, G-C pairing rules, Watson couldn't sleep all night from excitement. This discovery rewrote biology!

fun_facts.text_en: Watson entered University of Chicago at 15, got PhD at 22 - a child prodigy!
His book 'The Double Helix' vividly described DNA discovery, becoming a science bestseller.
Won Nobel Prize at 34, one of the youngest Nobel laureates in Physiology or Medicine.

experiment.description_en: Watson and Crick made base and backbone models with metal plates and wire, trying combinations like building blocks. They found double helix only stable with A-T, G-C pairing. This physical model helped them 'see' DNA's true structure.
experiment.why_en: Base pairing follows chemical bond length and angle constraints, only specific pairs form stable structure.

simple_explanation.text_en: Imagine DNA as a twisted ladder. Ladder sides are sugar and phosphate, middle rungs are base pairs. A always holds hands with T, G always with C. This ladder can unzip, each half can copy a complete ladder - that's the secret of heredity!

impact.text_en: DNA double helix discovery launched molecular biology era! It explained heredity's essence, spawning revolutionary technologies like genetic engineering, gene therapy, personalized medicine. Watson later led Human Genome Project, continuing to advance life sciences.

influenced.contribution_en: Invented PCR technology, amplifying DNA fragments

influence_chain.legacy_text_en: Watson built on Franklin's X-ray photos and Chargaff's base ratio data, collaborating with Crick to construct DNA model. This discovery spawned entire molecular biology field, with Sanger, Mullis developing sequencing and amplification technologies, ultimately completing Human Genome Project.

quiz.question_en: Which base does Adenine (A) pair with in DNA?
quiz.explanation_en: In DNA, Adenine (A) always pairs with Thymine (T), Guanine (G) pairs with Cytosine (C). This is the key rule Watson and Crick discovered.
